The Fed’s tapering plan is more of a threat to stock valuations than the Omicron variant, Morgan Stanley analysts argue.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics: </strong></span><span>President Biden’s big video call with Russian President Vladimir Putin is </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/06/us/politics/biden-putin-call-ukraine.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">happening today</a></span><span>. Biden will reportedly warn Putin that if he decides to invade Ukraine, then the US and its allies will move to unplug Russia from the global financial system.</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/NYC-announces-covid-vaccine-mandate-private-employers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Gotham Sends Out the Vax Signal
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/NYC-announces-covid-vaccine-mandate-private-employers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="NYC skyline with the syringe standing in for the Empire State Building " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/719fbadee68694ac37c96b8d2978697d6e60f805-2048x1365.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Getty Images/Neil Emmerson</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All private-sector employees in New York City, from Wall Street traders to Times Square Power Rangers, will <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-new-york-new-york-city-476a856e401bb826d3e828f6e580408d?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">need to be vaccinated</a> against Covid-19, Mayor Bill de Blasio said yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In justifying the new rule (a “first-in-the-nation” measure, per de Blasio), the mayor said the spread of Delta + the incoming Omicron variant + more inside activities during winter = a potent mix that could lead to a worsening Covid picture in the city over the next few months.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">The Xs and Os:</strong></span><span> Employees at ~184,000 businesses in the city will need to have at least one dose of the vaccine by Dec. 27. There is no testing option alternative.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NYC currently requires proof of vaccination for adults to enter restaurants, work out at gyms, or watch the Knicks be mediocre at MSG, but it’s tightening those requirements as well: Children ages 5–11 will need to flash their vax cards to participate in indoor activities starting Dec. 14.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Business groups are pushing back</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“We were blindsided,” Partnership for New York City President Kathryn Wylde <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/12/06/world/omicron-variant-covid?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. “There’s no forewarning, no discussion, no idea about whether it’s legal or who he expects to enforce it.” Wylde added that the requirement was counterproductive to de Blasio’s efforts to get workers back in the office and revitalize business districts (the vax mandate only applies to employees who work in-person).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">De Blasio is probably thinking, “Not my problem.” On Jan. 1, he’s being replaced by bitcoin bull and <a href="https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=574289623865794" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">certified party animal</a> Eric Adams, whose office said he will “evaluate” the policy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>NYC is pushing ahead with a private-sector vax requirement while Biden’s federal mandate has hit a legal brick wall. That proposal, which would apply to all companies with 100+ employees and was set to go into effect on January 4, has been blocked by a federal appeals court.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/US-Announces-Diplomatic-Boycott-Beijing-Winter-Olympics?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
<div>US Diplomats Will Watch Curling From Home<br>
</div>
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/US-Announces-Diplomatic-Boycott-Beijing-Winter-Olympics?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Ice hockey players participate in a test event for the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympic Games" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3970e036017de2c4c9be68028b50f84d0963e36e-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Han Haidan/China News Service via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US will stage a “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-06/biden-administration-to-boycott-winter-olympics-in-beijing?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">diplomatic boycott</a>” of the Beijing Winter Olympics in February, citing the Chinese government’s human rights abuses and “crimes against humanity” in the Xinjiang region.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s a diplomatic boycott? </strong>The US won’t send any officials to Beijing, but the cool people—athletes—are free to go and compete.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-wont-send-officials-to-beijing-winter-olympics-11638801009?mod=hp_lead_pos11" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supported</a> a diplomatic boycott as a way for the US to protest China’s crackdown on political dissidents and ethnic minorities. But some politicians, such as Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, said the US is just figure skating around the issue and should have fully boycotted the games.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>During the Cold War in 1980, the US barred athletes from competing in the Summer Olympics in Moscow following the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The Biden administration's move is sure to escalate tensions between the world’s two largest economies and was immediately labeled “outright political provocation” by the Chinese Foreign Ministry. The announcement also gives an opening to other governments that have considered a diplomatic boycott (Australia and the Netherlands, for two) to go through with it.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPAC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/SEC-investigating-Trump-SPAC-Nunes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Digital World Acquisition Carnival
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It was another normal one for Digital World Acquisition Corp., folks. On Monday morning, the SPAC that’s taking former President Trump’s media startup public disclosed that it’s the subject of a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/06/trump-spac-investigated-by-federal-regulators-including-sec.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">probe by the SEC</a> and another financial regulator, FINRA.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You may remember DWAC for its dizzying autumn rally of more than 1,200% in just two days, following the announcement that it would merge with Trump Media & Technology Group.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The regulators asked DWAC for information related to its trading policies, investors, and communications with Trump's media company. A <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/29/business/trump-spac-digital-world.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT report</a> in October found that the Digital World CEO and Trump met as early as March about the SPAC deal, which would be a potential securities violation—SPACs are not allowed to pick merger targets prior to raising money.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That seemed like the end of it, until…</strong>GOP Congressman Devin Nunes of California said he would resign from Congress in the coming weeks to become CEO of Trump’s fledgling social media company in January.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Although a well-known Trump loyalist, it’s still a surprising move for Nunes, who was in line to be the <a href="https://twitter.com/JakeSherman/status/1467971604017815557?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ways and Means chairman</a> if the Republicans took back the House next year.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

They’re built (that’s right, BUILT) with a proprietary stretch denim that look like jeans but feel like your coziest pair of sweatpants.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We could keep saying all of that stuff; you know, how these jeans are nice enough to wear to work but also comfy enough for a day spent on the couch. But you’re smart and you get it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You understand that <a href="https://mugsy.com/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=MB120721" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mugsy Jeans</a> stretch. They look like fashionable jeans. And one guy even said (with an eloquence we can only dream to achieve), “I used to hate jeans. Now I don’t.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We should also mention the good people at Mugsy are even <a href="https://mugsy.com/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=MB120721" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stretching themselves</a> to offer super comfy chinos, shorts, pullovers, and hoodies.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/key-performance-indicators-december-7?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">

Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/06/key-performance-indicators-december-7?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Patek Philippe watch with Tiffany" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/aef7ce6e405dc3eadc85a778e5f07384db9abd98-740x416.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Patek Philippe</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Swiss watchmaker Patek Philippe is releasing <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/06/patek-philippe-brings-back-the-holy-grail-of-watches-for-170-lucky-buyers.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">170 limited-edition versions</a> of its famous Nautilus Ref. 5711 watch in partnership with Tiffany. It’s retailing for $52,635, but if you can get your hands on one you can likely resell it for a much greater fortune. Patek recently announced it will be retiring the Ref. 5711 next year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “If you're on this call, you are part of the unlucky group that is being laid off.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vishal Garg, the CEO of online mortgage company Better.com, told about 900 employees at the company they were <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/900-bettercom-employees-learn-jobs-are-eliminated-zoom-call-rcna7738?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">out of a job</a> in a single 3-minute Zoom call last week. A few days later, Garg posted messages on an anonymous professional network accusing at least 250 of those employees of “<a href="https://fortune.com/2021/12/03/better-com-ceo-attacks-laid-off-employees-blind-message-board/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stealing</a>” from their colleagues and customers by working an average of 2 hours a day, Fortune reported.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A profile of Jeremy Strong, the enigmatic but brilliant actor who plays Kendall Roy on <em>Succession</em>. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/12/13/on-succession-jeremy-strong-doesnt-get-the-joke?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The New Yorker</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/doordash-launches-first-fast-grocery-delivery-service?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
DoorDash Enters the DoorRace
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/doordash-launches-first-fast-grocery-delivery-service?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="DoorDash bag on roller skates with a rocket" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/467cd79c7d9367894a6d178e79b2dafc7071ec23-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DoorDash <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/12/6/22820197/doordash-launches-fast-delivery-option-new-york-city-dash-corps?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is launching</a> an ultrafast delivery pilot program in NYC’s Chelsea neighborhood to compete with the rush of other 15-minutes-or-less delivery startups in the city.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s not the only new play in the playbook. </strong>After exclusively relying on a workforce of gig workers and spending $47 million on a <a href="https://www.axios.com/the-gig-economy-is-on-the-ballot-ae76eee1-368a-440f-bc89-073fef84fa99.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">California ballot measure</a> to keep it that way, DoorDash is hiring 60 full-time couriers with benefits and standardized pay to work under a new subsidiary, DashCorps.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>DoorDash said the decision to make the positions full-time (and some additional roles part-time) was a mix of logistics and outdated employment laws.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everyone wants their ham in 10 minutes.</strong> Ultrafast grocery delivery services, which operate by strategically plopping “dark stores” in urban neighborhoods, have become more popular this year than making fun of Lin-Manuel Miranda. In fact, speedy delivery startup Jokr hit <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/12/03/jokr-becomes-a-unicorn-after-usd260-million-series-b-round?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unicorn status</a> last week after launching just six months ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead..</strong>.Instacart could be the next delivery dinosaur to shove its way into the crowded ultrafast delivery market next year, according to The Information.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For every Bob Dylan, there’s a Robert Zimmerman. We’ll give you a famous musician’s birth name, and you have to figure out what they’re known by professionally.</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll private-sector employees in New York City, from Wall Street traders to Times Square Power Rangers, will \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-health-new-york-new-york-city-476a856e401bb826d3e828f6e580408d?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eneed to be vaccinated\u003c/a\u003e against Covid-19, Mayor Bill de Blasio said yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn justifying the new rule (a “first-in-the-nation” measure, per de Blasio), the mayor said the spread of Delta + the incoming Omicron variant + more inside activities during winter = a potent mix that could lead to a worsening Covid picture in the city over the next few months.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Xs and Os:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Employees at ~184,000 businesses in the city will need to have at least one dose of the vaccine by Dec. 27. There is no testing option alternative.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNYC currently requires proof of vaccination for adults to enter restaurants, work out at gyms, or watch the Knicks be mediocre at MSG, but it’s tightening those requirements as well: Children ages 5–11 will need to flash their vax cards to participate in indoor activities starting Dec. 14.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBusiness groups are pushing back\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“We were blindsided,” Partnership for New York City President Kathryn Wylde \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/12/06/world/omicron-variant-covid?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. “There’s no forewarning, no discussion, no idea about whether it’s legal or who he expects to enforce it.” Wylde added that the requirement was counterproductive to de Blasio’s efforts to get workers back in the office and revitalize business districts (the vax mandate only applies to employees who work in-person).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDe Blasio is probably thinking, “Not my problem.” On Jan. 1, he’s being replaced by bitcoin bull and \u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=574289623865794\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecertified party animal\u003c/a\u003e Eric Adams, whose office said he will “evaluate” the policy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eNYC is pushing ahead with a private-sector vax requirement while Biden’s federal mandate has hit a legal brick wall. That proposal, which would apply to all companies with 100+ employees and was set to go into effect on January 4, has been blocked by a federal appeals court.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eHan Haidan/China News Service via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US will stage a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-06/biden-administration-to-boycott-winter-olympics-in-beijing?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediplomatic boycott\u003c/a\u003e” of the Beijing Winter Olympics in February, citing the Chinese government’s human rights abuses and “crimes against humanity” in the Xinjiang region.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s a diplomatic boycott? \u003c/strong\u003eThe US won’t send any officials to Beijing, but the cool people—athletes—are free to go and compete.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLawmakers on both sides of the aisle \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-wont-send-officials-to-beijing-winter-olympics-11638801009?mod=hp_lead_pos11\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupported\u003c/a\u003e a diplomatic boycott as a way for the US to protest China’s crackdown on political dissidents and ethnic minorities. But some politicians, such as Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas, said the US is just figure skating around the issue and should have fully boycotted the games.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDuring the Cold War in 1980, the US barred athletes from competing in the Summer Olympics in Moscow following the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Biden administration's move is sure to escalate tensions between the world’s two largest economies and was immediately labeled “outright political provocation” by the Chinese Foreign Ministry. The announcement also gives an opening to other governments that have considered a diplomatic boycott (Australia and the Netherlands, for two) to go through with it.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDigital World Acquisition Carnival\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt was another normal one for Digital World Acquisition Corp., folks. On Monday morning, the SPAC that’s taking former President Trump’s media startup public disclosed that it’s the subject of a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/06/trump-spac-investigated-by-federal-regulators-including-sec.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprobe by the SEC\u003c/a\u003e and another financial regulator, FINRA.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou may remember DWAC for its dizzying autumn rally of more than 1,200% in just two days, following the announcement that it would merge with Trump Media \u0026 Technology Group.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe regulators asked DWAC for information related to its trading policies, investors, and communications with Trump's media company. A \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/29/business/trump-spac-digital-world.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT report\u003c/a\u003e in October found that the Digital World CEO and Trump met as early as March about the SPAC deal, which would be a potential securities violation—SPACs are not allowed to pick merger targets prior to raising money.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat seemed like the end of it, until…\u003c/strong\u003eGOP Congressman Devin Nunes of California said he would resign from Congress in the coming weeks to become CEO of Trump’s fledgling social media company in January.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlthough a well-known Trump loyalist, it’s still a surprising move for Nunes, who was in line to be the \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/JakeSherman/status/1467971604017815557?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWays and Means chairman\u003c/a\u003e if the Republicans took back the House next year.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Patek recently announced it will be retiring the Ref. 5711 next year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote:\u003c/strong\u003e “If you're on this call, you are part of the unlucky group that is being laid off.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVishal Garg, the CEO of online mortgage company Better.com, told about 900 employees at the company they were \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/900-bettercom-employees-learn-jobs-are-eliminated-zoom-call-rcna7738?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eout of a job\u003c/a\u003e in a single 3-minute Zoom call last week. A few days later, Garg posted messages on an anonymous professional network accusing at least 250 of those employees of “\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2021/12/03/better-com-ceo-attacks-laid-off-employees-blind-message-board/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estealing\u003c/a\u003e” from their colleagues and customers by working an average of 2 hours a day, Fortune reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead: \u003c/strong\u003eA profile of Jeremy Strong, the enigmatic but brilliant actor who plays Kendall Roy on \u003cem\u003eSuccession\u003c/em\u003e.
